newsitem.title: CHINA: China's disasters cause $3.2 bln in losses.
newsitem.headline: China's disasters cause $3.2 bln in losses.

text.p: Geological disasters in China such as landslides cause an average of 27 billion yuan ($3.2 billion) in losses each year, the China News Service said on Monday.
Direct economic losses caused by geological disasters accounted one quarter of losses caused by all kinds of natural disasters, it said.
The report attributed the rise in geological disasters to pollution, overpopulation and excessive extraction of natural resources.

For example, the population of southwestern Sichuan province doubled in the past 50 years while the number of geological disasters, including hill collapses and landslides, had quadrupled, it said, but give no further details.
